articles.title: Organisational Policies
IAMAI flags rushed DPDP rollout
articles.summary: The Internet and Mobile Association of India has asked the government to slow enforcement of the Digital Personal Data Protection framework, warning rushed timelines could disrupt businesses. It said companies were promised an 18-month transition but may now get far less. IAMAI cautioned this could create operational, legal and compliance risks across the digital ecosystem.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics raises Rs 1,248 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
articles.summary: The AI firm allocated 1.3 crore equity shares to 52 anchor investors at Rs 900 per share. Domestic mutual funds accounted for nearly 38% of the anchor book. The IPO has been priced at a discount of about 26% to its most recent private market valuation in July 2025. Noting that the company could have raised capital at a higher valuation in private markets, Fractal Analytics cofounder and group CEO Srikanth Velamakanni said public market investors often evaluate AI companies differently from speci

articles.title: Fintechs should join the govt’s anti-fraud platform to help curb the menace: Financial services secretary Nagaraju
articles.summary: Fintech startups should join the government-backed fraud detection platform — India Digital Public Intelligence — as shareholders along with public sector banks, said M Nagaraju, secretary, department of financial services, ministry of finance.

articles.title: India’s largest pre-silicon chip validation facility opens at C-DAC Bengaluru
articles.summary: The Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) has launched the PRITVI-ACE pre-silicon validation facility in Bengaluru to strengthen India’s semiconductor design ecosystem. According to C-DAC officials, it enables end-to-end validation, from individual IP blocks to full system-level designs, well before silicon fabrication. These include early operating system boot, firmware and driver validation, protocol compliance checks and performance benchmarking at near-real-world speeds.

articles.title: PhysicsWallah raises stake in Kamya Yoga & Wellness to 41% with Rs 1.5 crore investment
articles.summary: Noida-based edtech firm PhysicsWallah (PW) will raise its stake in Kay Lifestyle and Wellness to 41.18% by subscribing to 300 seed CCPS for Rs 1.5 crore. PW currently holds 28.57% and could increase its share up to 50% under the agreement. The investment is expected to complete by February 2027.

articles.title: Tech shares, bitcoin stabilise after a week of severe declines
articles.summary: Indian markets are set for a positive start. Technology stocks are showing signs of recovery after a tough week. Bitcoin's sharp fall appears to have paused, offering some relief. Investors are watching these developments closely. Global markets are also experiencing mixed movements. This could influence trading trends in the coming sessions.

articles.title: PB Fintech shelves plan to raise funds for acquisitions via QIP
articles.summary: In a regulatory filing to stock exchanges on Friday, the company said its management and board are not considering a qualified institutional placement (QIP), refuting a media report.

articles.title: Tesla is training its AI technology in China: Report
articles.summary: ​Tesla ⁠is operating an artificial ‌intelligence ‌training ‌centre in China focusing on local ​application ​and assisted ‌driving, ‍Chinese ‍media outlet Cailianshe reported ‌on Friday, citing the company's ‍Vice President ‍Tao ⁠Lin.

articles.title: Capillary Technologies’ Q3 profit down 23% to Rs 8 crore; revenue up 16%
articles.summary: The company said its revenue growth was mainly supported by expansion within its existing customer base, onboarding of new enterprise clients, and revenue from Kognitiv, the martech firm it acquired last year. Capillary now works with over 115 enterprise customers spread across 47 countries.

articles.title: Turkey edges towards curbing social media access to minors amid global push
articles.summary: Turkey is preparing a draft law to restrict social media for minors, after a parliamentary report urged age verification and content filtering. President Tayyip Erdogan’s AK Party is expected to submit the bill soon, the Family and Social Services minister said. Australia already banned under-16s, as Spain, Greece and Slovenia consider similar controls.

articles.title: PhonePe takes its diversification to Dalal Street
articles.summary: Payments still power scale. But its updated draft red herring prospectus (UDRHP) shows that PhonePe’s monetisation story lies elsewhere.

articles.title: Pine Labs receives GST tax demand of Rs 37.33 crore
articles.summary: This follows an appeal order issued by the Office of the Joint Commissioner of Commercial Taxes (Appeals)-4, Bengaluru. Pine Labs plans to file an appeal against the Joint Commissioner’s order before the Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal (CESTAT).

articles.title: Intel, AMD notify customers in China of lengthy waits for CPUs
articles.summary: The supply constraints have driven up prices for Intel's ⁠server products in China by more than 10% generally, although pricing varies by customer contract, according to one of the people.

articles.title: Social media's role must be assessed from lens of societal harmony, trust: Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Noting that social media is now among the most important modes of information and outreach, the minister said while it offers benefits such as learning, its broader impact must be clearly assessed to ensure they add value to society, their content is trustworthy and the platforms do their due diligence.

articles.title: VC-backed wealth management startups see revenue rise, losses widen
articles.summary: India’s wealthtech startups have raised over $100 million in 2024-25 but many remain sub-scale, with losses outpacing revenue growth. For instance, Dezerv reported Rs 66 crore in revenue and a net loss of Rs 112 crore, while Centricity posted Rs 10 crore revenue and a Rs 4.3 crore loss. Investors say growing assets under management is the key focus.

articles.title: IT ministry to examine all views and take a call: Secy on age bar for social media access
articles.summary: The Indian government is considering age-based access to online platforms. This follows suggestions in the Economic Survey to curb digital addiction. The IT Secretary stated all opinions will be examined before a decision is made. Schools and parents also have a role in shaping children's digital habits. Measures by countries like Australia are being noted.

articles.title: India-US Technology Forum sets sight on $500 billion trade target: Nasscom
articles.summary: The Nasscom US CEO Forum met in Washington DC to boost India-US technology and trade. The goal is USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. Discussions covered innovation, AI, and job creation. Indian tech firms contribute significantly to the US economy. Energy security was a key focus. The forum aims for co-creation in technology.

articles.title: India Semiconductor Mission 2.0 to ensure long-term policy stability, says MeitY Secretary
articles.summary: The Government of India plans to sustain the growth of the domestic semiconductor industry through the upcoming launch of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) 2.0.

articles.title: Union minister Amit Shah launches 'Bharat Taxi' app
articles.summary: The Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Thursday launched the 'Bharat Taxi' App, aimed at strengthening cooperative participation and enhancing welfare measures for taxi drivers across the country.

articles.title: US software stocks stabilise after bruising selloff on AI disruption fears
articles.summary: Software and data services stocks stabilized on Thursday after a bruising selloff, as investors looked ‍for clues on whether fast-advancing artificial ​intelligence tools are starting to dent demand for traditional software and subscription businesses.

articles.title: India negotiating new FTAs
articles.summary: FTA: India is actively participating in regional and plurilateral platforms to support diversified and sustainable supply chains, including the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF), minister Jitin Prasada said.

articles.title: Dairy, sugar kept out of New Zealand FTA
articles.summary: India-NZ FTA: Major exclusions include dairy products; vegetable products; sugar and sugar confectionery; and animal, vegetable or microbial fats and oils.

articles.title: Imports from China fall across sectors in FY25; mobile phone exports surge
articles.summary: India's imports from China saw a significant decline in 2024-25 across key sectors like fertilisers, chemicals, and iron and steel. Notably, mobile phone imports plummeted while exports surged dramatically, indicating a shift in trade dynamics. The government is actively implementing measures to address stakeholder concerns and safeguard national interests.

articles.title: Build-own-transfer to be priority for highway projects in FY27: Nitin Gadkari
articles.summary: The government plans to boost highway construction via public-private partnerships, prioritizing the build-own-transfer model and asset monetization. With a significant budget increase for the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, India aims to strengthen its infrastructure to become the world's third-largest economy. Existing highways will also be monetized to further this goal.

articles.title: PM MITRA parks get infra boost
articles.summary: Expenditure of ₹564.72 crore has been incurred so far on the seven PM Mega Integrated Textile Region and Apparel (PM MITRA) parks, the textile ministry told Parliament.

articles.title: Govt to form panel to align tax, accounting rules and cut India Inc compliance burden
articles.summary: A joint panel will be formed by the corporate affairs ministry and CBDT by March-end. This initiative aims to align tax computation rules with accounting standards. The move will reduce compliance burdens for Indian companies. It also seeks to minimize litigation arising from differences between accounting and tax frameworks.

articles.title: Pulses prices jump up to 20%; tur, urad return to MSP levels
articles.summary: Pulse prices are climbing after a year of falling. Tur, chana, and urad have seen significant increases. Tur and urad have reached minimum support price levels. Lower crop output in India and other countries, along with currency issues, are pushing prices up. Farmers may see improved sentiment ahead of the next planting season. New chana arrivals could impact prices later.

articles.title: Net impact of AI on jobs positive, managing the transition to new tech a challenge: RBI
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Deputy Governor Poonam Gupta stated that artificial intelligence will have a net positive impact on employment, despite job losses in some sectors. A recent RBI survey indicates significant productivity gains from AI, with no negative employment effects observed currently. The primary challenge lies in managing the transition for the labor market.

articles.title: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra allays fears over govt borrowing in FY27, asks to focus on net number
articles.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra addressed concerns about the government's borrowing plans for FY27. He highlighted that net borrowing has seen a modest increase, assuring a smooth borrowing program. The high gross borrowing figure is attributed to upcoming maturities. This clarification aims to ease investor unease regarding potential crowding out effects in the financial system.

articles.title: Govt using tech in big way in farm sector, 8.48 crore farmers given digital IDs so far: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
articles.summary: The Indian government is significantly boosting technology in agriculture. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced that 8.48 crore farmers now have digital IDs across 19 states. This AgriStack initiative aims to create a single source of truth for farmer identity, land, and crops. It facilitates seamless delivery of various government schemes and benefits to farmers.

articles.title: RBI ‘very comfortable’ with gold loan exposure despite sharp volatility in prices, says Guv Sanjay Malhotra
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has expressed comfort regarding outstanding gold loans in the financial system, despite recent price volatilities. Governor Sanjay Malhotra stated that loan-to-value ratios are well below prescribed norms, mitigating concerns about potential borrower defaults. Reviews of MSME and personal loans also indicated good asset quality.

articles.title: India has secured Annex on EU CBAM to cut GHG emissions: Govt to Parliament
articles.summary: India-EU FTA: The Annex establishes a Technical Dialogue wherein India and EU will engage on technical exchanges on implementation of carbon border adjustment measuresincluding their product scope and embedded emissions coverage; monitoring,reporting and verification processes, and the possibility to take into account the carbon price effectively paid in the other Party under a carbon emissions reduction scheme.

articles.title: Govt proposes merging Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana & Krishonnati Yojana
articles.summary: The government is proposing to merge two central agriculture schemes, Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana and Krishonnati Yojana, into a single umbrella scheme. This move aims to provide greater flexibility to states in implementing need-based agricultural components. Inter-ministerial consultations are currently underway for the proposed restructuring.

articles.title: RBI’s wait-and-watch stance signals confidence in growth: Economists
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has kept its key interest rate steady. Economists agree this is a prudent move given strong economic growth and changing inflation trends. The central bank is also awaiting updated economic data. Experts believe the RBI will focus on managing money supply to keep lending rates accessible.

articles.title: India's imports from China dip in multiple sectors in 2024-25: Jitin Prasada
articles.summary: India's imports from China have seen a significant drop in 2024-25. Sectors like fertilizers, chemicals, iron, steel, and man-made yarn show reduced import figures. Mobile phone imports have also fallen sharply. Conversely, India's mobile phone exports have experienced a massive increase. The government is encouraging diversification of supply chains.

articles.title: RBI leaves door open for more rate cuts
articles.summary: Interest rates are expected to stay low and potentially fall further, according to RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra. He indicated that deposit rates will also adjust downwards. Trade deals are projected to boost GDP by about 20 basis points, and incentives for data centers are anticipated to attract significant foreign investment. The RBI is confident in managing the government's borrowing program.

articles.title: How India plans to safeguard ‘Chicken’s Neck’ through an underground rail network
US-India partnership strengthens global fight against fentanyl: Report
articles.summary: The US DEA dismantled an India-linked online fentanyl network, seizing over 200 domains tied to deadly overdoses. Authorities stressed growing US-India cooperation to stop drug trafficking upstream, as fentanyl remains a major threat despite falling overdose deaths.

articles.title: India's NSE to set up unit for proposed national coal trading exchange
articles.summary: India's National Stock Exchange has approved a new unit to manage a national coal trading platform. This platform will allow electronic trading of physical coal using standardized contracts. It aims to address price inefficiencies and improve access for smaller participants. The exchange will facilitate physical delivery and potentially derivative products in the future.

articles.title: Iran's surging crypto activity draws US scrutiny
articles.summary: Crypto use in Iran is surging amid sanctions and currency collapse, prompting U.S. scrutiny of platforms for possible sanctions evasion, while researchers debate the scale of state-linked activity versus retail adoption as millions turn to digital assets nationwide economic strain.

articles.title: Gold bounces back on softer dollar, US-Iran concerns; silver rebounds
articles.summary: Gold rebounded on Friday, poised for a weekly gain driven by bargain hunting, a weaker dollar, and ongoing U.S.-Iran talks. Silver also recovered from a recent low, though both metals are showing signs of entering a commodity bust phase. CME Group raised margin requirements amid heightened volatility.

articles.title: Dish TV India sinks deeper into losses in Q3 as subscription revenues continue to slide
articles.summary: Dish TV reported a net loss of approximately Rs 276 crore for Q3 FY26, sharply higher than the loss of around Rs 47 crore reported in the same quarter last year. The company reported exceptional items of around Rs 70 crore during the quarter, taking the loss before tax to about Rs 276 crore.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics raises Rs 1,249 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO; Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs among key backers
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics raised Rs 1,249 crore from 52 anchor investors at Rs 900 per share ahead of its IPO opening February 9. Strong domestic and global institutional demand signals confidence in the AI analytics firm and growth prospects globally strong.

articles.title: Tata Steel Q3 profit soars 9-fold YoY to Rs 2,730 crore on Dutch unit boost
articles.summary: Tata Steel’s consolidated net profit surged more than ninefold from a year earlier in the December quarter as a sharp improvement in profitability at its Dutch unit and steady operations in India helped offset wider operating losses in the UK.

articles.title: RBI removes VRR cap, reshapes FPI debt limits to boost bond inflows
articles.summary: RBI scrapped the Rs 2.5 lakh crore VRR cap, folding it into FPI debt limits from April, boosting flexibility and ease of doing business while retaining safeguards on foreign ownership. Existing VRR investments shift to general limits, with gains expected.

articles.title: RBI issues draft rules for credit derivatives and total return swaps linked to corporate bonds
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released draft rules for derivatives on credit indices and total return swaps (TRS) linked to corporate bonds.

articles.title: NSE Board approves IPO via OFS, forms a committee to drive listing process
articles.summary: The National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) has received board approval for its Initial Public Offering (IPO) via an Offer for Sale (OFS). This move follows a decade-long wait and Sebi's no-objection, with the IPO expected to be a significant event in India's capital markets. A reconstituted IPO Committee will oversee the listing preparations.

articles.title: IREDA board approves Rs 2,994 crore fund raising plan via QIP mode
articles.summary: State-run power NBFC Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) on Friday approved a Rs 2,994 crore fundraising plan via the qualified institutions placement (QIP) mode.

articles.title: Spencer's Retail Q3 loss widens to Rs 58.4 cr, revenue slips marginally
articles.summary: The company posted a net loss of Rs 47.34 crore in the October-December period a year ago, according to a regulatory filing from Spencer's Retail, a RP Sanjiv Goenka group firm.

articles.title: InCred Holdings, Elevate Campuses among 8 IPOs approved by Sebi
articles.summary: Sebi has approved eight IPOs across financial services, infrastructure, engineering, education and manufacturing, signalling steady primary market momentum. InCred Holdings leads the pipeline, alongside offerings from engineering, IT, metals, education, jewellery and electronics firms cleared for listing in coming months.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: LIC, Godfrey Phillips among 6 stocks that hogged limelight on Friday
articles.summary: Indian markets closed higher as buying in consumer and private banks offset losses in auto, IT and pharma. Stock-specific moves in BEML, LIC, Hitachi Energy and others drove action across the board.

articles.title: Anand Rathi reports Rs 13 crore fraud by unknown individuals, group company employees
articles.summary: Anand Rathi Share and Stock Brokers on Friday informed the exchanges that its Internal Inquiry Committee has discovered a Rs 13 crore fraud. The brokerage said that the crime has been committed by certain unknown individuals in connivance with employees of group company Anand Rathi IT Private Limited.

articles.title: Research symposium at India AI Impact Summit draws world's AI minds
articles.summary: The Research Symposium on 'AI and its Impact', being organised as part of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, has received a strong response from the national and global research community, with over 250 submissions.

articles.title: Apple plans to allow external voice-controlled AI chatbots in CarPlay: Report
articles.summary: Apple is preparing ​to allow voice-controlled artificial intelligence apps ⁠from other companies in CarPlay. The change ‌represents a ‌strategic shift for Apple, which, until now, has only ‌allowed its own Siri assistant as a voice-control option.

articles.title: Indians show no urge to press buy button for AI PCs
articles.summary: Global demand for AI PCs is slowing faster than expected, and India is seeing a similar trend as buyers hesitate over higher prices. Gartner has cut its 2026 forecast, citing weak consumer interest and lack of compelling software. Hardware limits, especially memory shortages, are further holding back adoption.

articles.title: Startup India sops to boost deeptech firms’ revenue, research
articles.summary: The government's move to allow deeptech startups into the Startup India scheme could improve their ability to raise funds and build technologies, founders and investors said. DPIIT brought deeptech startups under the programme with more lenient regulations. Founders said long cycles and sustained capital need regulatory stability and long-term commitment.

articles.title: Security concerns, scepticism bursting bubble of Moltbook, viral AI social forum
articles.summary: Moltbook is a new "social network" built exclusively for AI agents to make posts and interact with each other, and humans are invited to observe. Elon Musk said its launch ushered in the "very early stages of the singularity " - or when artificial intelligence could surpass human intelligence.

articles.title: Security concerns and scepticism are bursting the bubble of Moltbook, the viral AI social forum
articles.summary: A new social media platform called Moltbook has emerged, exclusively for AI agents. Humans can observe but not directly participate. This development has generated significant buzz, with some hailing it as a step towards the singularity. However, security researchers have uncovered critical vulnerabilities, raising alarms about data exposure and potential manipulation.

articles.title: IIT Madras & Unicorn India Ventures launch Rs 600-crore deeptech fund
articles.summary: IIT Madras and Unicorn India Ventures have launched a Rs 600-crore deeptech fund, with a Rs 400-crore greenshoe option, to support early-stage, IP-driven startups. The fund will back engineering-heavy firms in robotics, space, defence, semiconductors, and medical technology, investing Rs 8–10 crore in over 25 startups.

articles.title: How India is gearing up to power its AI ambitions
articles.summary: In the official pre-summit event to the India AI Impact Summit 2026, Hitachi Energy India will bring together stakeholders to deliberate on - Can our power grids fuel our AI ambitions?

articles.title: Fractal Analytics IPO: CEO and early investors set to make up to 2,24,000% returns
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics’ upcoming ₹2,834-crore IPO is set to generate significant wealth for promoters and early investors, allowing them to monetise long-term investments as India’s first pure-play AI company goes public at a top price of ₹900 per share. The issue, opening February 9–11, includes a ₹1,023-crore fresh issue and a ₹1,810-crore offer for sale.

articles.title: Post Monetary Policy Press Conference | RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra | LIVE
AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank says it has not submitted financial bid for IDBI Bank stake sale
articles.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank denied submitting a financial bid for IDBI Bank, countering media reports. Bids were received from Fairfax Financial and Emirates NBD for the 60.7 percent stake sale.

articles.title: GST intelligence conducts search at Go Digit General Insurance; company says no material impact
articles.summary: DGGI Gurugram searched Go Digit General Insurance in February under GST Act. No adverse findings yet. Go Digit, Pune-based, is cooperating and sees no material impact on business.

articles.title: Auto wrap this week: Mercedes reveals 2026 F1 car; Honda, Suzuki, Yamaha launch models
articles.summary: India’s auto sector saw several launches this week, from Mercedes-AMG Petronas revealing its 2026 F1 car to Honda, Suzuki and Yamaha updating 125cc scooters and introducing electric mobility options.

articles.title: London High Court rejects Nirav Modi plea to delay Bank of India loan trial
articles.summary: A London High Court judge has refused fugitive businessman Nirav Modi’s last-minute attempt to stall proceedings in the Bank of India loan recovery case, holding that prison conditions and health issues did not place him at a substantial disadvantage ahead of the eight-day trial starting later this month.

articles.title: Railways readies DPRs for Kashmir rail expansion; no timeline yet for new lines
articles.summary: The Railway Minister said fresh rail projects in Jammu and Kashmir will require multi-level approvals, including from NITI Aayog and the finance ministry, even as the recently commissioned USBRL project delivers jobs, roads and improved connectivity across the Valley.

articles.title: AI firm Fractal Analytics mops up ₹1,248 crore in anchor round; IPO opens February 9
articles.summary: Backed by heavyweight domestic mutual funds, insurers and global institutions, the AI and data analytics firm will open its ₹2,834-crore public issue next week, with proceeds earmarked for debt repayment, R D, expansion and strategic initiatives.

articles.title: India to shift to risk-based deposit insurance premiums from April 1
articles.summary: India will introduce risk-based deposit insurance premiums from April 2026, replacing flat rates to reward stronger banks, penalise weaker ones, and improve risk management overall.

articles.title: Top Stories | RBI policy call, agri safeguards in India-US deal, PFC-REC merger nod & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: India slips to fourth in MSCI EM Index weight as South Korea pulls ahead
articles.summary: India’s weight in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index has slipped to fourth as investors chase AI- and semiconductor-led rallies elsewhere, with foreign outflows and limited tech exposure weighing on domestic equities.

articles.title: Icra sees 10-12% copper demand growth in India over next 2 years
articles.summary: Copper usage in India is surging, driven by rapid urbanisation, infrastructure development, and the green energy transition.

articles.title: This RBI rule change could bring cheaper, longer money to REITs
articles.summary: Ramesh Nair, MD & CEO, Mindspace Business Parks REIT, said REIT cost of funding has declined over the last nine months due to lower interest rates, with a higher share of fixed-rate debt. He added that new funding options could support acquisitions and that government plans to route public sector assets through REITs could support industry growth.

articles.title: Global uncertainty drives market volatility; India relatively stable: Emmer Capital CEO
articles.summary: Manishi Raychaudhuri, Chief Executive Officer, Emmer Capital Partners said India has remained relatively stable compared with other Asian markets. He sees opportunities in financials, materials, industrials, and selective consumer stocks, while remaining cautious on IT services due to AI disruption risks.

articles.title: RBI MPC holds repo rate at 5.25% after December cut: The beginning of a long pause
articles.summary: RBI policy keeps repo rate steady at 5.25%, signals stability ahead. Top reactions from bankers, economists and market experts.

articles.title: Yunus administration fast-tracks Bangladesh-US trade pact ahead of polls, industry flags risks
articles.summary: Reports that the Yunus led interim administration signed a non-disclosure agreement with United States last year have added to the concern. If accurate, it means negotiation details cannot be publicly discussed.

articles.title: RBI MPC meet 2026 highlights | Should be looking at net borrowing figure, not gross, says Governor Sanjay Malhotra
articles.summary: RBI MPC meet 2026 LIVE: RBI MPC keeps repo rate at 5.25%, citing benign inflation and strong growth. Governor Sanjay Malhotra notes EU and US trade deals, but warns of rising geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Government borrowing of ₹17.2 lakh crore to be completed in non-disruptive manner: Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur
articles.summary: Talking about the Budget announcement related to Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs), Thakur said the industry's long-pending demand has been accommodated in this Budget.

articles.title: AIADMK revives loan waiver, expands welfare push as TN fiscal space comes into focus
articles.summary: AIADMK’s poll promises—education loan waiver, minority loans and transport subsidies—reignite debate on Tamil Nadu’s finances, with debt and deficit near FRBM limits ahead of elections.

articles.title: GCC expects FTA with India to reduce global uncertainty
articles.summary: India signed Terms of Reference for a potential FTA with Gulf Cooperation Council, aiming to boost trade, investment, and jobs. GCC includes Saudi Arabia, UAE, Oman, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain.

articles.title: Finance Commission hearings expose deep Centre–states rift over tax devolution, cess sharing
articles.summary: With most states arguing that rising cess and surcharge collections have eroded the shareable tax pool, the Finance Commission hearings have become a forum for deeper questions on fiscal autonomy, constitutional limits, and how India’s federal finances should be recalibrated amid mounting spending pressures.

articles.title: India says it will buy oil where it makes sense, keeps Venezuela option open
articles.summary: India says it remains open to buying crude from Venezuela as part of its energy diversification push, stressing market viability, sanctions compliance and long-term supply security.

articles.title: How global companies are quietly turning India into their second home
articles.summary: Global capability centres are reshaping India’s office market, jobs and capital flows, turning the country into a long-term hub for high-value global work and growth.

articles.title: What will India buy from the US for $500 billion? Piyush Goyal answers
articles.summary: The Modi administration has been faced with the big question ever since India promised to buy American products, as part of the tariff truce with the Trump administration.

articles.title: RBI policy expectations: Rate pause likely in February, focus shifts to liquidity moves
articles.summary: RBI Policy expectations: Most economists polled by CNBC-TV18 expect a rate pause through 2026. The central bank is likely to use liquidity tools to manage bond yields and funding conditions while keeping macro forecasts steady ahead of new data series.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: ‘Flooded with partnership requests’: Ambani on Reliance’s pull; Fink says India outpaces US in digitisation
articles.summary: Ambani was speaking to CNBC-TV18, sharing the stage with BlackRock chairman and CEO Larry Fink. The two are already partners—BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, and Jio launched a 50:50 joint venture in 2023 to build an asset management business in India

articles.title: India-US FTA: All the furore over inclusion of agriculture and dairy in the deal
articles.summary: India-US FTA announcement has sparked controversy as US officials flag zero tariffs on farm goods, Opposition and farmer unions protest, while government insists agriculture and dairy remain protected.

articles.title: RBI likely to stay on hold in February as trade deal improves macro comfort
articles.summary: Despite differing medium-term views, the Citizen MPC panel unanimously expects the RBI to keep the repo rate unchanged at the February 6 meeting, with Samiran Chakraborty indicating a dovish pause stance.

articles.title: On US India deal, Goyal says energy diversification paramount for India
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal stressed energy diversification and security for India, while US-India talks hint at expanding trade and reducing Russian oil reliance, but no formal commitments were announced.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: Budget 2026 | PSU bank mergers, capital rule changes on the table as India aims for bigger global banks: DFS Secretary
articles.summary: The Financial Services Secretary said the proposed Banking Committee for Viksit Bharat will have a wide mandate, including examining whether India’s regulatory capital framework needs greater flexibility and whether further public sector bank consolidation could help create globally competitive lenders.

articles.title: India's exports to get boost with US cutting tariff: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump's decision to slash tariffs on Indian goods to 18% augurs well for the country as it will boost exports, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said Tuesday.

articles.title: IRFC joins forces with Tuticorin port and Sagarmala Finance to boost big infrastructure projects
articles.summary: IRFC, VOCPA and SMFC signed an MoU to finance the Outer Harbour Development Project at Tuticorin Port, boosting multimodal infrastructure under Sagarmala and PM Gati Shakti plans.

articles.title: US Trade Representative Greer claims India agreed to zero tariffs on industrial goods
articles.summary: Speaking to CNBC International, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said India has agreed to cut tariffs on most industrial goods to zero and lower duties on a wide range of agricultural products.

articles.title: India-US tariff cut to 18% is a big step forward, but execution at home will decide gains: Meera Shankar
articles.summary: The sharp tariff rollback offers India a stronger footing against several emerging market competitors in the US, but former envoy Meera Shankar cautions that the real gains will depend on how quickly India tackles domestic cost and logistics hurdles to convert the lower duty into sustained export momentum.

articles.title: With trade overhang gone, India Inc can plan investments better: Axis Bank’s Neelkanth Mishra
articles.summary: Neelkanth Mishra, Chief Economist, Axis Bank and Head-Global Research, Axis Capital said the agreement is a positive step but noted that global trade remains dynamic and subject to policy changes. He added that domestic economic factors and interest rate transmission will continue to play a key role in economic growth.

articles.title: Banking reforms panel to examine need for new banks, corporate entry: DFS Secretary M Nagaraju
articles.summary: Elaborating on the need for banks to have deep pockets in order to meet the Vikisit Bharat goals, the Secretary said exclusion of corporates from the banking space makes investments difficult.

articles.title: India could gain a stronger global footing through US, EU trade deals: BofA economist
articles.summary: India’s US imports could rise from $50 billion to $100 billion mainly through substitution from other partners, with carve-outs for sensitive sectors, says Rahul Bajoria, Head of India & ASEAN Economic Research, BofA Global Research

articles.title: India unlikely to fully stop Russian oil purchases, says former foreign secretary
articles.summary: Former Foreign Secretary Kanwal Sibal said agriculture concessions under trade deals are likely to remain limited, while global trade outcomes reflect negotiation pressure and strategic positioning.

articles.title: DIPAM receives financial bids for IDBI Bank privatisation
articles.summary: DIPAM has confirmed receipt of financial bids for IDBI Bank, signalling renewed momentum in the long-running privatisation of the state-owned lender.

articles.title: Force Motors to acquire Veera Tanneries for ₹175 crore, deal subject to due diligence
articles.summary: Shares of Force Motors Ltd ended at ₹21,418.85, up by ₹344.35, or 1.63%, on the BSE.

articles.title: IREDA board approves ₹2,994 crore QIP to boost renewable energy financing
articles.summary: Shares of India Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) ended at ₹128.30, down by ₹1.60, or 1.23%, on the BSE.

articles.title: NSE Q3 net profit up 15% QoQ on higher trading volumes and cost savings
articles.summary: National Stock Exchange of India Ltd (NSE) reported Q3FY26 consolidated total income of ₹4,395 crore, up from ₹4,160 crore in Q2FY26. Profit after tax rose 15% QoQ to ₹2,408 crore, supported by higher trading volumes in equity cash and derivatives segments and cost efficiencies.

articles.title: Mitsubishi Electric India to invest ₹2,100 crore in Chennai facility at Mahindra Origins
articles.summary: Mitsubishi Electric India inaugurated a ₹2,100 crore air-conditioner and compressor plant near Chennai, boosting localisation, manufacturing capacity and employment, while reinforcing Tamil Nadu’s position as a key electronics and industrial hub.

articles.title: PFC board gives in-principle approval for merger of REC with itself
articles.summary: Shares of Power Finance Corporation Ltd ended at ₹419.20, up ₹1.85, or 1.01%, on the BSE. In contrast, shares of REC Limited closed at ₹372.50, down ₹9.60, or 2.51%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Tata Chemicals to spend ₹515 crore on Tamil Nadu salt plant
articles.summary: Tata Chemicals will invest ₹515 crore to set up an IVSD salt plant in Tamil Nadu with 210 KTPA capacity, creating a second production base and improving supply to southern markets.

articles.title: Kalyan Jewellers Q3 net profit nearly doubles to ₹416 crore on operational efficiency gains
articles.summary: Shares of Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd ended at ₹379.80, up by ₹3.60, or 0.96%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Bharat Electronics receives orders worth ₹581 crore, including radar and communication equipment
articles.summary: Shares of Bharat Electronics Ltd ended at ₹429.55, down by ₹3.30, or 0.76%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Now smaller NBFCs are exempt from RBI registration: What this means for borrowers and businesses
articles.summary: RBI exempts NBFCs with assets up to ₹1,000 crore and no public funds from registration, boosting financial inclusion, say industry leaders.

articles.title: Exclusive: UPL, Coromandel among 4 firms in race for US-giant FMC's India biz
articles.summary: UPL, Dhanuka, Coromandel, and Crystal Crop may bid for FMC’s India unit, worth $450M, as FMC seeks to cut debt and refocus globally.

articles.title: Air India CEO defends airline’s safety systems after Boeing 787 fuel switch investigation
articles.summary: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson said the London Dreamliner episode underscores the strength of aviation safety protocols, with crew reporting, regulatory checks and precautionary inspections working as intended even as the UK regulator seeks further explanations.

articles.title: Alembic Pharma secures USFDA final nod for Parkinson’s therapy tablets
articles.summary: Alembic Pharmaceuticals received USFDA approval for Carbidopa, Levodopa and Entacapone tablets, which is indicated for the treatment of Parkinson's disease. Q3 revenue rose 10.8% but net profit fell 4.1%.

articles.title: RBI policy shook the bond market, stocks may follow
articles.summary: Yields on the 10-year bonds increased sharply soon after the end of the Governor's statement. Here's why.

articles.title: RBI NBFC reforms: No-registration rule for small NBFCs and relaxed housing loan norms for UCBs
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India announced reforms easing registration and branch rules for smaller NBFCs, with Governor Sanjay Malhotra stressing continued financial stability and robust sector resilience.

articles.title: RBI proposes collateral-free MSME loan cap hike to ₹20 lakh
articles.summary: RBI proposes raising collateral-free loan cap for MSMEs to ₹20 lakh, with repo rate unchanged at 5.25 percent. Liquidity measures aim to boost credit, growth, and employment, says Shashank Udupa.

articles.title: RBI to launch unified portal to streamline bank data management
articles.summary: RBI will launch a unified portal for lead bank scheme data, boost MSME loan cap to ₹20 lakh, and propose digital banking safety measures, aiming to improve transparency and financial inclusion.

articles.title: Government invites application for SAIL CMD post
articles.summary: Government headhunter PESB on Thursday invited applications for the post of Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL).

articles.title: RBI clears Asia II Topco XIII to acquire up to 10% stake in Federal Bank
articles.summary: Shares of Federal Bank Ltd ended at ₹287.00, down by ₹0.35, or 0.12%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Top stories: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha, stocks slide, RBI MPC tomorrow, HAL chief on fighter jet race & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: Swiss watch brand Atlantic Watches plans to double India stores as demand for mid-priced luxury watches grows
articles.summary: After a strong first year in India, Swiss watchmaker Atlantic Watches is scaling up its retail presence, banking on rising demand for mid-priced luxury timepieces and India’s growing relevance in the global Swiss watch industry.

articles.title: No country is AI-ready: Pearson CEO flags skill gaps in India, warns of vocational shortage
articles.summary: India and other major economies face deep-rooted workforce challenges as artificial intelligence accelerates, with Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh warning that shortages in vocational skills and educator preparedness could slow inclusive AI adoption.

articles.title: UltraTech Cement commissions additional 2.7 MTPA grinding capacity in Aligarh
articles.summary: UltraTech Cement’s total domestic grey cement manufacturing capacity now stands at 191.36 MTPA. Including its overseas capacity of 5.4 MTPA, the company’s total global cement capacity has reached 196.76 MTPA.

articles.title: Mad Over Donuts initiates minority stake sale amid flurry of dessert deals
articles.summary: Gourmet doughnut chain Mad Over Donuts explores private equity investment with teasers having been sent to prospective suitors amid deal buzz in India’s QSR and dessert segment.

articles.title: AI is making skills go obsolete faster, so learning how to learn is the real job now: Pearson CEO
articles.summary: As AI tools rapidly take over routine professional tasks, Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh says continuous learning—not static qualifications—will determine who stays relevant in the workforce, as companies and employees confront a multi-year disruption driven by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Global markets may bleed, but India will win: Quant MF’s Sandeep Tandon explains why
articles.summary: Quant Mutual Fund Founder & CIO Sandeep Tandon says global market stress could redirect capital flows towards India, even as he flags selling exhaustion, a sharp portfolio shift towards private banks and insurance, and valuation risks in overheated sectors such as defence and global technology.

articles.title: NSE board approves IPO via OFS
articles.summary: The National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) on Friday announced that its governing board has formally approved plans to launch its long‑delayed initial public offering (IPO) through a pure Offer for Sale (OFS) by existing shareholders. The approval marks a major step forward in a listing journey that has stretched nearly a decade.

articles.title: Commodities cool off, but investors aren't calling the end of the rally yet: Elara Capital
articles.summary: Elara Capital says the commodity pullback looks like consolidation, not reversal, as fund flows stay supportive of de-dollarisation, emerging markets, and energy despite short-term volatility.

articles.title: SBI set for steady Q3 show as loan growth holds firm, profit growth stays muted
articles.summary: All eyes will be on SBI’s management commentary around loan growth momentum, asset quality trends and margin outlook, as investors assess the bank’s ability to sustain performance amid higher provisions and an unchanged interest rate environment.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves hit fresh record of $723.8 bn after $14.4 bn weekly surge
articles.summary: India's forex reserves hit a record $723.774 billion, driven by a $14.595 billion surge in gold reserves, while foreign currency assets dipped and SDRs and IMF position increased, says Reserve Bank.

articles.title: Sula Vineyards' profit slumps for fifth straight quarter as Karnataka destocking hits Q3
articles.summary: Net profit was down 67.5% year-on-year to ₹9.1 crore, compared with ₹28 crore in the same period last year.

articles.title: Big profit drop for Jana SFB in Q3, but deposits and asset quality offer comfort
articles.summary: Net interest income (NII) rose 13.8% YoY to ₹675 crore, up from ₹593 crore in the corresponding quarter last year.

articles.title: BLS International posts strong Q3 as profits soar, bags big visa and Aadhaar deals
articles.summary: Operating performance saw some pressure, with the EBITDA margin slipping to 26.9%, from 30.8% in the year-ago quarter, reflecting a contraction of 390 basis points.

articles.title: Ratnamani Metals feels the heat in Q3 as profit and revenue slide
articles.summary: Revenue from operations declined 19.8% YoY to ₹1,055.8 crore, down from ₹1,316 crore in the same period last year.

articles.title: RBI’s move will unlock long-term bank funding, says Indian REITs Association
articles.summary: RBI now lets banks lend directly to REITs, boosting funding options for Brookfield, Embassy, Mindspace, Nexus Select, and Knowledge Realty Trust.

articles.title: Amit Shah begins two-day Jammu & Kashmir visit to review security, inaugurate development works
articles.summary: Amit Shah’s packed itinerary in Jammu includes a ground-level security assessment along the International Border, rollout of welfare initiatives for border guards, and high-level meetings focused on counter-terror preparedness and the region’s development roadmap.

articles.title: TVK chief Vijay must pay ₹1.5 crore income tax penalty, orders Madras High Court
articles.summary: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy said the order imposing the penalty was valid and therefore did not warrant judicial intervention. He clarified it was open to the petitioner to contest the order before the appropriate appellate authority.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Minister says North Indians 'clean tables,' sell 'pani puri'; BJP calls it 'reckless and dangerous'
articles.summary: Speaking at an event in Chengalpattu, Panneerselvam talked about people from North India working in low-paying jobs.

articles.title: Maharashtra council panel summons comedian Kunal Kamra over remarks against Deputy CM Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: Kamra and Andhare were initially asked to appear before the panel at 2 pm on February 5. However, after both of them expressed their inability to attend, the hearing has now been rescheduled to February 17, the committee chairperson and BJP MLC Prasad Lad told PTI on Wednesday.

articles.title: Centre ‘attempting to silence’ Rahul Gandhi: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
articles.summary: Stating that Rahul Gandhi raised legitimate questions on national security based on excerpts from 'Four Stars of Destiny', the book authored by Naravane, he said the book, originally slated for release in 2024, remains unpublished because it is "being withheld" by the Government of India.

articles.title: Karnataka excise 'scam': BJP MLAs mark overnight protest against 'ATM sarkar' with bhajans, sloganeering
articles.summary: The agitation, underway since Tuesday night, entered its second day with BJP legislators seen taking a morning walk inside the Assembly building.

articles.title: Heated exchange between Rahul and MoS Ravneet — From 'my traitor friend' to 'Desh ke dushman'
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi called Ravneet Singh Bittu a traitor at Parliament during Congress protests over MM Naravane's memoir; eight MPs were suspended.

articles.title: Who is Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki leader likely to be Deputy CM of Manipur
articles.summary: She represents the Kangpokpi Assembly constituency and also previously helmed several ministries in the state government.

articles.title: Who is Yumnam Khemchand Singh, the BJP MLA set to be Manipur's next CM
articles.summary: BJP MLA Yumnam Khemchand Singh is set to become Manipur Chief Minister, bringing legislative experience and a rare martial arts distinction.

articles.title: BJP 'mastermind' behind Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy CM, claims Saamana
articles.summary: The Opposition Shiv Sena (UBT) on Monday claimed the BJP leadership was the "mastermind" behind NCP leader Sunetra Pawar taking oath as Maharashtra deputy chief minister, just days after her husband Ajit Pawar's demise.

articles.title: National Statistics Office proposes migration survey in July 2026: All you need to know
articles.summary: NSO will conduct a Survey on Migration in July 2026-June 2027 to update data on migration patterns, with PLFS 2020–21 showing a 28.9 percent migration rate and strong gender differences.

articles.title: ‘What is scaring the government?’ asks Rahul Gandhi after Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah object over Doklam remarks
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi cited unpublished memoirs of General MM Naravane on Doklam in Parliament, prompting Rajnath Singh to challenge the authenticity and request proof before Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla.

articles.title: YSRCP condemns rise in attacks on party leaders, terms it 'planned strategy' of Naidu govt
articles.summary: A group of people, believed to be TDP activists, raised slogans against Jogi Ramesh and Ambati Rambabu, alleging that they had made objectionable remarks against Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and Minister Nara Lokesh. The group allegedly removed banners outside Ramesh's house, entered the premises, damaged furniture and glass panes, and set a portion of the house on fire.

articles.title: Maharashtra Cabinet rejig: Fadnavis to hold Finance; Sunetra Pawar gets Excise, Sports and Minority Affairs
articles.summary: Fadnavis is likely to present the Maharashtra annual budget. However, most of the groundwork for the budget had already been completed under Ajit Pawar’s supervision before his death. Sunetra Pawar was assigned Excise, Sports and Minorities Development portfolios.

articles.title: Trains to get AI alerts when lions go near tracks in Gir National Park, Lion Wildlife Sanctuary
articles.summary: Indian Railways has cleared an AI-based intrusion detection system along 115 km of track in Gir National Park and Lion Wildlife Sanctuary to track lion movement and alert loco pilots and stations, Parliament was told.

articles.title: Vaishnaw touts Indian Railways’ financial health; LHB coach production up 18-fold
articles.summary: Ashwini Vaishnaw told Rajya Sabha Indian Railways' financial health improved, energy costs fell, and LHB coach production rose eighteenfold, addressing PV Abdul Wahab's concerns for Kerala.

articles.title: Supreme Court sets aside rape case, says consensual relationship not criminal offence
articles.summary: The Supreme Court quashed a Bilaspur rape FIR, ruling it was a consensual relationship between lawyers and not a crime due to the complainant's marriage.

articles.title: Around 50% of India's analysed aircraft show repetitive flaws, says govt data
articles.summary: Government data shows nearly 50 percent of Indian airline aircraft have repetitive technical defects, with Air India reporting the highest rate at 82.5 percent, raising safety and oversight concerns.

articles.title: India’s big Gulf push: Why a potential trade deal with six Arab nations may worry Pakistan
articles.summary: An FTA with the GCC would deepen trade as well as broader ties with the six member countries. For GCC nations, India offers size, stability and a diversified economic opportunity at a time of global uncertainty.

articles.title: Delhi to create transport authority for metro, buses, rail; fund planned
articles.summary: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta has set up a task force to draft a bill for a Unified Metropolitan Transport Authority and urban transport fund, aiming to integrate metro, buses and rail under one system.

articles.title: JSW MG Motor's upcoming Majestor SUV drives to Mount Japfü summit ahead of India debut
articles.summary: JSW MG Motor India said its Majestor SUV climbed Mount Japfü in Nagaland during testing, as the company prepares to unveil what it calls India’s first D+ segment SUV on 12 February.

articles.title: Supreme Court permits termination of minor’s 30-week pregnancy, stresses reproductive autonomy
articles.summary: The Supreme Court said that the central issue was the right of the minor to decide whether to continue the pregnancy. The Bench noted that the pregnancy was, on its face, “illegitimate” as the girl herself was a minor and was facing the situation as a result of an unfortunate relationship.

articles.title: 'India has no option but to...': Pakistani leadership’s PoK speeches intensify Kashmir tensions
articles.summary: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif and Field Marshal Asim Munir visited Pakistan-occupied Kashmir and have been openly promoting jihad, declaring that "Kashmir will be liberated soon".

articles.title: Rain and snowfall to continue across Western Himalayas; Delhi NCR to see fog, gusty winds
articles.summary: The IMD indicated that minimum temperatures over northwest India are unlikely to see significant changes over the next two days, followed by a brief dip and a gradual rise thereafter.

articles.title: ASI has 3,686 protected sites; none missing at present Government tells Parliament
articles.summary: The government has told Parliament that all centrally protected monuments under the Archaeological Survey of India are currently traceable, even as it acknowledged instances of unauthorised construction around several heritage sites and said enforcement action has been taken under the AMASR Act.

articles.title: Operation Sindoor | Tom Cooper’s new book claims India dominated May 2025 conflict with Pakistan
articles.summary: Tom Cooper’s book 88-Hours War claims India gained air superiority over Pakistan in May 2025, following the Pahalgam attack, shifting the regional balance of power.

articles.title: Took refuge in lies: Rahul slams PM Modi over his Rajya Sabha address
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi accused Narendra Modi of avoiding tough questions and lying in Rajya Sabha, while Modi countered by alleging Congress insulted the President, tribals, Dalits, and the northeast.

articles.title: Over 3,800 Indian nationals deported from US in 2025: Government tells Parliament
articles.summary: Over 3,800 Indian nationals were deported from the US in 2025, the government informed the Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

articles.title: PM Modi in RS: 'India is a loud voice of Global South' amid a world in flux
articles.summary: PM Modi emphasised India’s dominance within the Global South, asserting that the country is emerging as its key voice amid a churning international order.

articles.title: SC takes serious note of delay by several states in sending proposal for DGP appointment
articles.summary: The apex court granted four weeks to the UPSC to convene a meeting and make recommendation for appointment of Director General of Police (DGP) for Telangana, where the last regular DPG retired in 2017.

articles.title: Mumbai court clears DHFL, now Piramal Finance, in ₹5,050 crore money laundering case
articles.summary: A Mumbai special PMLA court discharged DHFL, now Piramal Finance, in a ₹5,050 crore money laundering case, granting immunity under Section 32A of the IBC after its takeover through insolvency.

articles.title: CBI didn't give clean chit to YSRCP in ghee adulteration case: Andhra Deputy CM Kalyan
articles.summary: Pawan Kalyan stated CBI did not clear YSRCP in the Tirupati laddu ghee adulteration case, alleging animal fat use during YS Jagan Mohan Reddy's regime, sparking nationwide controversy.

articles.title: FLY91 adds two leased aircraft, sets target of 15 destinations by Q1 2026
articles.summary: Regional airline FLY91 has leased two aircraft from TrueNoord, raising its fleet to four as it expands routes from Goa and Hyderabad and targets 15 destinations by Q1 2026.

articles.title: Kerala Assembly urges Centre to withdraw VB-G RAM G Act, restore MGNREGA
articles.summary: Parliamentary Affairs Minister M B Rajesh said the VB-G RAM G Act was "anti-people" that deprives them of their right to work.

articles.title: India revises recognition criteria for startups to promote AI, deep-tech innovation
articles.summary: India has notified revised startup recognition norms, confirming CNBC-TV18’s January 28 newsbreak, raising turnover limits, introducing a deep-tech category and expanding eligibility to cooperatives to boost innovation-led growth.

articles.title: Apple begins hiring for retail roles in Hyderabad
articles.summary: Apple has issued a job notification seeking outlet managers and retail managers, among other roles, to be based here, sparking speculation that the iPhone maker may open a retail store in the city.

articles.title: BharatGen AI to cover 22 Indian languages in text by month-end; speech and vision for 15
articles.summary: Union minister Jitendra Singh told Rajya Sabha that BharatGen will finish text services for all 22 scheduled Indian languages by month-end, with speech and vision modules ready in 15 languages.

articles.title: Explained — Why Nvidia, Broadcom shares rose after Alphabet's capex announcement
articles.summary: Unlike many peers that rely heavily on industry-standard Nvidia processors, much of Google’s AI software runs on its in-house TPUs. The company’s latest flagship model, Gemini 3, was trained using these proprietary chips. Broadcom works with Google on the design and manufacturing of its TPUs.

articles.title: AI is the new oil: Nations, not companies, are racing for global dominance
articles.summary: Hemant Mohapatra of Lightspeed Venture Partners says the global AI race is increasingly being shaped by national control over chips, data, and foundation models. As countries build their own AI ecosystems, India’s push for sovereignty through local data, domestic model-building, and semiconductor manufacturing could determine its place in the future AI order.

articles.title: Exclusive | AI is a once-in-a-century opportunity for India: Mukesh Ambani
articles.summary: Mukesh Ambani and Larry Fink believe India is uniquely positioned to lead the global AI revolution, with Reliance placing a major bet on the technology as the country’s next growth engine. From transforming education and healthcare to boosting productivity, AI could redefine India’s economic standing over the next two decades.

articles.title: Apple’s Xcode now supports Anthropic’s Claude Agent SDK: What it means
articles.summary: Xcode 26.3 has introduced a native integration with the Claude Agent SDK, which is the same underlying harness powering Claude Code.

articles.title: Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radar
articles.summary: Nitish Mittersain, Joint MD and CEO of Nazara Technologies said that the company saw about 10% organic revenue growth and more than 25% profitability growth, excluding acquisitions and deconsolidation. The company invested about ₹500 crore in acquisitions last year and has about ₹700 crore in net cash. The company may raise capital if required, but no decision has been finalised.

articles.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI to work with 'extremely powerful models' soon: What it means
articles.summary: With Dylan Scandinaro's appointment as the Head of Preparedness at OpenAI, Sam Altman said the company will be working with "extremely powerful models soon."

articles.title: Anthropic’s new AI tool is threat to which companies and services — and what's next
articles.summary: The concern is no longer about AI supporting existing models, but replacing entire layers of corporate work. Anthropic's new AI tools, and the rapid evolution of AI capabilities is forcing investors to reconsider long-standing assumptions about the defensibility of data, research and software subscription businesses.

articles.title: Google Chrome unveils Gemini 3-powered ‘auto browse’: What it does and risks
articles.summary: This powerful agentic tool automates multi-step tasks such as research travel costs, booking appointments, and managing subscriptions directly for you.

articles.title: ChatGPT outage resolved after brief disruptions, says OpenAI
articles.summary: OpenAI noted that about 14 components were affected in the outage, including one related to the APIs and 13 related to ChatGPT.

articles.title: What is Anthropic’s new AI tool and why it has triggered a ‘SaaSpocalypse’
articles.summary: Anthropic’s new AI tool plugins are aimed at automating tasks across legal, sales, marketing and data analysis functions, intensifying fears of disruption across the software ecosystem. It has triggered a steep sell-off in software and legal companies' shares.

articles.title: Bajaj Life Insurance to apply for pension fund manager and GIFT City licences
articles.summary: Bajaj Life Insurance plans to set up an IFSC Insurance Office at GIFT City, Gandhinagar and seek a PFM licence, expanding services for NPS subscribers, NRIs, and global clients.

articles.title: 360 ONE Mutual Fund to launch its first SIF on February 6
articles.summary: The minimum investment amount for the fund is ₹10 lakh, while accredited investors can invest with a minimum of ₹1 lakh. The exit load is set at 0.5% if redeemed within three months from the date of allotment.

articles.title: SEBI mulls overhaul of 'fit and proper person' framework governing market intermediaries
articles.summary: Markets regulator Sebi on Wednesday proposed a comprehensive overhaul of the 'fit and proper person' framework governing market intermediaries, aiming to bring greater procedural clarity and fairness to the regulatory process.

articles.title: Muthoot FinCorp launches NCD issue to raise up to ₹600 crore
articles.summary: Muthoot FinCorp opens its first NCD tranche from February 3 to 16, aiming to raise up to ₹600 crore for lending and debt repayment, with Crisil AA-/Positive and BWR AA/Stable ratings.

Inside Deepflow Technologies’ mission to bring reliable farm intelligence to Indian farmers
articles.summary: Kannur-based agritech startup Deepflow Technologies offers a unified platform that enables farmers and farmer collectives to manage multiple crops simultaneously, instead of building solutions around a single crop.

articles.title: AI a catalyst for financial inclusive growth: Finance Ministry official
articles.summary: The official highlighted that India’s strong digital public infrastructure, including Aadhaar, UPI, and Account Aggregator, provides a solid foundation for the responsible and scalable adoption of AI.

articles.title: IIT Madras Research Park, Unicorn India Ventures launch Rs 600 Cr fund for deeptech startups
articles.summary: The 'Unicorn Frontier Fund I' targets IP-led robotics and defence startups, offering patient capital to boost domestic tech sovereignty and reduce import reliance.

articles.title: Project Tarasha showcases the magic of design collaborating with art and entrepreneurship
articles.summary: In this photo essay, we showcase a range of artworks from a unique four-day craft exhibition in Bangalore International Centre.

articles.title: Veranda Learning Q3 profit soars 110% as 'Veranda 2.0' strategy gains traction
articles.summary: Veranda Learning reported a net profit of Rs 17 crore, driven by a 52% revenue rise. The company is accelerating its "Veranda 2.0" strategy, focusing on cost efficiency and advancing the demerger of its commerce vertical.

articles.title: Startup news and updates: Daily roundup (February 6, 2026)
articles.summary: YourStory presents the daily news roundup from the Indian startup ecosystem and beyond. Here's the roundup for Friday, February 6, 2026.

articles.title: India’s ACC battery demand seen surging to 700 GWh by mid-2040s: Report
articles.summary: IESA has outlined two demand scenarios — a Business-as-Usual case and a Viksit Bharat Pathway — under which total battery demand could reach between 1.3 terawatt-hours (TWh) and 1.9 TWh by 2047.

articles.title: India open to Venezuelan oil imports: Commercial viability key to diversified energy sourcing
articles.summary: India is exploring oil purchase options from Venezuela and other countries. The government prioritizes energy security for its citizens. Diversifying energy sources is key to this strategy. India s actions will align with market conditions and global dynamics. This comes as trade discussions with the US include potential shifts in oil sourcing.

articles.title: Tata Power awaits regulatory clarity on nuclear plans; exploring land options in three states
articles.summary: Company evaluates SMR options and site feasibility even as regulatory framework for private nuclear projects evolves.

articles.title: India free to source oil from anywhere, diversification nothing new: Kremlin
articles.summary: Energy analyst Igor Yushkov of the National Energy Security Fund said Indian refiners cannot fully replace Russian crude with US supplies.

articles.title: India will diversify energy supplies after deal with US on Russia oil imports
articles.summary: This comes after reports of a US trade deal involving India halting Russian oil purchases. Indian refiners have not received official directives to cease Russian oil imports.

articles.title: IEX energy trade volume grows 19% to 13,050 MU in January
articles.summary: The Day-Ahead Market and Real-Time Electricity Market experienced growth. The Green Market also recorded an increase in volume. Prices in the green day-ahead market decreased.

articles.title: Amit Shah calls for tech-driven solutions to border challenges, holds high-level review meet on J&K security
Studies vs gaming: Strike a balance, PM Modi tells students
articles.summary: PM Modi, at Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026, urged students to find balance between academics and skills, emphasizing life and professional skills are intertwined. He encouraged pursuing gaming as a skill, drawing from Indian stories, but warned against gambling. Collaborative learning and prioritizing Class XII exams were also highlighted, with a call for parents to trust their children's individual growth.

articles.title: 3rd extension in UP SIR: 1 more month for filing claims
articles.summary: The Election Commission has granted a one-month extension for filing claims and objections on Uttar Pradesh's draft electoral rolls, now allowing submissions until March 6. This marks the third extension for the state's voter list revision, with the final rolls to be published on April 10.

articles.title: 'When told I'm 75, I said 25 yrs left': PM Modi tells students to focus on future
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi advised students at 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' that education is for life, not just exams, emphasizing character and temperament over grades. He encouraged focusing on future goals rather than dwelling on past achievements, urging them to live in the present and plan for what lies ahead.

articles.title: 'I don't know what will happen to me': Pappu Yadav after arrest in 1995 case
articles.summary: Purnea MP Pappu Yadav was arrested by Patna Police in connection with a 1995 case, expressing fears for his safety and demanding to be taken directly to court. He questioned the police's methods and the timing of the arrest. The MP was later admitted to hospital due to health concerns.

articles.title: 'Can't be compelled': SC allows termination of minor's 30-wk fetus
articles.summary: The Supreme Court permitted a minor's pregnancy termination, acknowledging her right to reproductive autonomy and the lifelong trauma of an illegitimate child. Despite the Maharashtra government's concerns about a 30-week fetus's viability and the suggestion of an orphanage, the court prioritized the girl's mental well-being, directing the procedure with medical safeguards.

articles.title: Iran backs Chabahar port, ready to expand ties with India
articles.summary: Iran reaffirms its commitment to the Chabahar port and cooperation with India, despite US sanctions uncertainty. While a recent budget showed no allocation, India has fulfilled its $120 million commitment and maintains a $250 million credit line for future development. Iran's ambassador highlighted the port's strategic importance for regional access and expressed confidence in India's management of the situation.

articles.title: Can't misuse judiciary after poll drubbing: Supreme Court
articles.summary: The Supreme Court sternly criticized the Jan Suraaj Party for challenging Bihar's assembly elections, questioning their motive after a significant electoral defeat. Justices noted the party's failure to win any seats and suggested their petition aimed at gaining popularity. The court emphasized that economic policy issues are for voters to address, not judicial annulment of elections.

articles.title: Govt receives fin bids for IDBI’s strategic selloff
articles.summary: The government has received financial bids for the strategic disinvestment of IDBI Bank, marking significant progress in the stake sale. This move, involving a combined 60.7% stake sale by the government and LIC, is expected to fetch around Rs 33,000 crore.

articles.title: Old is gold as prices singe, rush for advance purchase
articles.summary: Indian consumers are actively exchanging old gold for new and accelerating wedding jewellery purchases due to soaring gold prices. Titan Company reports a significant increase in exchange-led sales, with nearly half of Tanishq's sales now involving exchanges. Consumers are opting for lighter-weight and lower-karat gold and diamond options to manage costs.

articles.title: RBI to roll out risk-based deposit insurance in April
articles.summary: Starting April 1, 2026, banks will pay deposit insurance premiums based on their financial health, a global shift. Stronger banks with better risk management will see reduced costs, while weaker ones face higher charges. Depositor protection remains unchanged at Rs 5 lakh per account, with no public disclosure of bank risk ratings.

articles.title: Cyber scammed? RBI plans compensation up to Rs 25,000
articles.summary: The RBI is set to introduce new rules to protect bank customers. Small digital fraud victims could receive up to Rs 25,000 compensation. Stricter guidelines will also target mis-selling of financial products and aggressive loan recovery practices. These measures aim to enhance consumer safety amidst growing cyber risks and unfair sales tactics.

articles.title: ‘Second-time mother’: Namibian cheetah gives birth to 5 cubs at Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh
articles.summary: Along with the announcement posted on X, Union environment minister Bhupender Yadav also shared a video of the cubs from the national park.

articles.title: Owaisi jibes Assam CM Himanta with ‘ ₹2 ki bheekh’ over his ‘ ₹4 rickshaw fare’ taunt for Miya Muslims
articles.summary: Owaisi further said the constitution has given equal rights to all, as he accused Sarma of "discrimination" against the “Miya Muslims”.

articles.title: Toilet cleaning chemical among Tirupati laddu adulterants: CM
articles.summary: CM Naidu alleged that adulterated ghee used for Tirupati laddus contained chemicals like toilet cleaner during the YSRCP regime, prompting strong political exchanges.

articles.title: Siddaramiah’s son dismisses leadership change talk
articles.summary: Karnataka's political leadership faces uncertainty as Congress leaders diverge in views, but Yathindra Siddaramaiah insists no change is imminent.

articles.summary: CID arrested 13 for creating mule bank accounts used by cybercriminals to transfer stolen money, identifying over 42,000 such accounts in a major operation

articles.summary: He said that Chabahar port is part of Iran’s capacity for boosting regional connectivity.

articles.summary: Ashis Ray's book explores how the 1945 INA trials at Red Fort accelerated India's path to independence, uniting diverse communities against British rule.

articles.summary: Delhi High Court ruled X Corp cannot refuse to join the Centre’s Sahyog portal for sharing info on cybercrime, emphasizing need for centralized data access.

articles.summary: The White House statement claimed that India will eliminate or reduce tariffs on all US industrial goods and a wide range of US food and agricultural products.

articles.summary: A draft of the upcoming CAFE-III norms had proposed leniency for petrol cars weighing 909 kg or less—a carve-out widely seen as favouring Maruti Suzuki.
